text: Vilibald Vuco (born 15 July 1996) is a Croatian professional footballer who plays for Croatian club NK Hrvatski Dragovoljac as a midfielder. ==Club career== Born in Split, Vuco joined NK Hrvatski Dragovoljac's youth setup in 2011, from HNK Hajduk Split. After a short-term loan deal at NK Stupnik in 2015, he made his debut for the club before moving to NK Rudeš in January 2016. Vuco contributed with three goals in 26 matches during the 2016–17 campaign, as his side achieved promotion to 1. HNL. He made his debut in the category on 16 July 2017, starting in a 1–1 away draw against NK Osijek. On 1 February 2018, Vuco moved to Rudeš' affiliate club Deportivo Alavés, signing an 18-month deal and being assigned to the reserves in Tercera División. ==References== ==External links== *Sport Manager profile * Category:1996 births Category:Living people Category:Sportspeople from Split, Croatia Category:Croatian footballers Category:Association football midfielders Category:Croatian First Football League players Category:Croatian Second Football League players Category:Croatian Third Football League players Category:Segunda División B players Category:Tercera División players Category:NK Hrvatski Dragovoljac players Category:NK Rudeš players Category:Deportivo Alavés B players Category:Croatian expatriate footballers Category:Expatriate footballers in Spain Category:Croatian expatriate sportspeople in Spain
title: Vilibald Vuco
